subject: Re: [junit] Re: Get AssertionFailedError when assert from another  thread.
msgSnippet: ... Right.  I thought of that, but shied away from it.  One could also write a custom implementation of Test. Anyway it is kind of nice that JUnit gives your
messageBody:
Brian Button wrote:

> import junit.framework.*;
>
> public class SocketServerTest extends TestCase {
> private TestResult result;
>
> public void run(TestResult result) {
> this.result = result;
> super.run(result);
> }

Right. I thought of that, but shied away from it. One could
also write a custom implementation of Test.

Anyway it is kind of nice that JUnit gives your the flexibilty
to solve the problem in a number (greater than 0) of ways.

I don't understand why TestResult and TestCase have a mutual dependence.
--
Cheers,
Theodore Norvell
